Service: Azure Cognitive Search (now Azure AI Search)

Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the search functionality, including data sources, indexing needs, query capabilities, and expected user experience.
Design the architecture for the search solution, including the integration of Azure Cognitive Search with the web application and other services.
Create and configure the Azure Cognitive Search service in the Azure portal, selecting the appropriate tier and region based on project requirements.
Define and configure indexes based on the data structure and search requirements. Include fields, analyzers, and scoring profiles.
Connect the search service to data sources such as Azure Blob Storage, SQL Database, or Cosmos DB. Configure data import and refresh schedules.
Enable security features such as API keys, role-based access control (RBAC), and encryption for data at rest and in transit.
Implement query logic in the web application to interact with the Azure Cognitive Search service. Include filters, facets, and autocomplete functionality.
Perform thorough testing of the search functionality, including indexing, query performance, and relevance of search results.
Optimize the search service for performance by tuning indexes, query logic, and scaling the service as needed.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the search service using Azure Monitor to track service health, query performance, and indexing status.
Create detailed documentation for the search solution, including architecture, configurations, and operational procedures.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the Azure Cognitive Search service.
Ensure the search solution meets regulatory compliance requirements and implement regular auditing procedures.
